abstracts.cdata!:
The Legal and Judicial Reforms Project
            aims to improve the existing legal and judicial framework by
            making it more efficient, transparent, and responsive to the
            needs of the public at large and of the private sector in
            particular. The project has three main components. The first
            component 1) addresses the weaknesses in the legal and
            regulatory framework that impacts private sector activity
            adversely and helps obtain expert input to identify and
            formulate a comprehensive reform policy; 2) strengthens the
            capacity of the institutions responsible for law reform and
            legal education in the area of commercial law by providing
            short-term training and materials, upgrading and introducing
            courses in the law school, and launching campaigns and
            disseminating materials to develop public awareness; 3)
            provides local and international training for lawyers in the
            Attorney General's office and judges; and 4) develops
            an automated and on line Legal Information Network (LAWNET),
            which includes statutes, government regulations, case
            information/court decisions, and textbook excerpts; and
            organizes and modernizes the storage and retrieval of
            related publications. The second component helps the Office
            of the Registrar of Companies (ORC) improve its
            administration, management, and regulatory capacities. The
            third component finances judicial training and faculty
            development, reorganizes the Judicial Services Commission,
            introduces model courts, and develops a formal mediation system.
